meanings.definition: Warn or signal to be prepared for danger or an emergency.
meanings.sent1: The loud siren was alerting everyone to evacuate the building.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard blew the whistle, alerting the swimmers to get out of the water.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog was alerting the family of the approaching visitor.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathering in the sky were alerting us to an incoming storm.
meanings.sent5: The flashing lights were alerting drivers to slow down for the construction ahead.

meanings.definition: The act of making someone aware of a potential threat or problem.
meanings.sent1: The alerting of the students about the fire drill was done through the intercom.
meanings.sent2: Her quick thinking and alerting of the authorities prevented a major disaster.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meowing was an amusing way of alerting its owner to feed it.
meanings.sent4: The red flags on the beach were alerting beachgoers of dangerous currents.
meanings.sent5: The loud alarm was an alerting that the store was closing soon.
